page.title: 03KENN AND KENNFORD FARMING 1
page.content: THE VILLAGES OF KENN AND KENNFORD ARE SURROUNDED BY NUMEROUS SMALL FARMS. THEY ARE TYPICAL OF MANY FARMS FOUND IN THE COUNTY. THEY ARE USUALLY FARMED BY A FAMILY. THE FARMERS WIFE OFTEN TAKES ADVANTAGE OF THE TOURISTS TO THE AREA BY OFFERING BED AND BREAKFAST ACCOMMODATION IN THE LARGE FARMHOUSE. THE FARMS ARE MIXED,HAVING CATTLE,SHEEP,PIGS AND POULTRY AS WELL AS GROWING CROPS SUCH AS WHEAT,OATS AND BARLEY. BECAUSE OF THE RICH PASTURE LAND THESE FARMS ENJOY,THE CATTLE IN THE MAIN ARE DAIRY CATTLE KEPT FOR THEIR MILK. FINE BUTTER AND CLOTTED CREAM ARE THE PRODUCTS OF THIS INDUSTRY.THERE IS A CATTLE MARKET IN EXETER ABOUT 5 KMS AWAY WHERE FARMERS BUY AND SELL THEIR ANIMALS. SOME FARMS SELL POTATOES AND OTHER VEGETABLES TO PASSING MOTORISTS.
